14141P-d-09-20-96-NIRC.Narrative: SWITCH CREW WAS GOING TO PICK UP A CAR WHEN THEY STRUCK A 480 VOLT ELECTRICAL BOX LOCATED ON THE SOUTH END OF TRACK #3 IN THE UPPER YARD. THE FRONT OF THE SWITCH ENGINE CLEARED THE BOX BUT THE REAR OFTHE ENGINE WITH THE PILOT DESIGN STRUCK THE BOX. FURTHER INVESTIGATION FINDINGS ARE THAT THE ELECTRICAL BOX WAS TOO CLOSE AND ACTUALLY IN THE FOUL FOR ENGINE MOVEMENTS O TRACK #3 IN THE UPPER YARD. THE COMBINATION OF THE PILOT DESIGN ON SWITCH ENGINE NIRC #4 AND THE ELECTRICAL BOX BEING THAT CLOSETO THE FOUL WAS THE MAIN REASON FOR THIS INCIDENT. NIRC #4 SWITCH ENGINE HAD NEVER TRAVERSED THAT TRACK BEFORE THIS INCIDENT.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

016001-d-09-08-96-ALM.Narrative: ALM SOUTH LOCAL WITH CREW MEMBERS D. CALK, OPERATING LOCOMOTIVE, & O. NEAL, ARRIVED KCS YARD, MONROE, LA ATTEMPTING TO DELIVER 16 RAILCARS. WAS ADVISED BY KCS EMPLOYEE TO DRAG THROUGH #3 TRACK, RETURNVIA THE MAIN LINE, & THAT OUTBOUND ALM CARS WERE IN TRACK #4. WHILE DRAGGING THROUGH #3 TRACK MR. CALK NOTED THAT THERE WERE SEVERAL COUPLINGS TO BE MADE IN #4 TRACK. WHILE MR. CALK WAS MOVING WEST UP THE MAIN LINE MR. NEAL DROVE AROUND TO THE KCS YARD OFFICE ON THE EAST END OF THE YARD TO SECURE THE NECESSARY PAPERWORK ON THE INTERCHANGE CUT. AT THIS TIME THERE WAS ONLY ONE KCS SWITCH CREW WORKING IN THE YAOD. AFTER COUPLING TO THE WEST END OF #4 TRACK, MR. CALK CONTACTED MR. NEAL ON THE RADIOSTATING THAT HE HAD SEEN SEVERAL JOINTS TO BE MADE IN #4 TRACK & HE WAS GOING TO COUPLE UP #4 TRACKIF MR. NEAL WOULD PROTECT THE EAST END OF #4 TRACK. MR. NEAL ACKNOWLEDGED THAT FACT THAT MR. CALK WAS GOING TO ATTEMPT TO COUPLE UP #4 TRACK. 91396-d-09-13-96-DSNG.Narrative: THE MOTOR GRADER HAD ENTERED THE D&SNG RIGHT OF WAY AND WAS MOVING NORTH (TIME TABLE DIRECTION WEST)ON A UTILITY ACCESS EASEMENT OF THE CITY OF DURANGO. THE OPERATOR, A CITY EMPLOYEE, WITHOUT THE KNOWLEDGE OF HIS CITY SUPERVISOR OR THE D&SNG AND IS CONSIDERED A TRESPASSER. AS TRAIN NO. 465 ROUNDEDTHE CURVE AT MP 455.1 AT AN ESTIMATED SPEED OF 20 MPH, THE GRADER WAS BEING OPERATED ALONG THE EDGEOF THE TIES IN THE SAME DIRECTION AS THE TRAIN, HAVING TRAVELED TO MP 455.2. WHEN THE FIREMAT DETERMINED THE GRADER WAS FOULING THE TRACK, HE COMMUNICATED THIS TO THE ENGINEER, WHO PLACED THE BRAKES INTO EMERGENCY. ON STEAM LOCOMOTIVES, THE FIREMAN CAN SEE ONLY THE LEFT SIDE OF THE TRACK AND THE ENGINEER ONLY THE RIGHT. THE LEFT SIDE OF ENGINE 73 STRUCK THE RIGHT SIDE BLADE BOOM OF THE GRADER ANDTHE TRAIN STOPPED 190 FEET AFTER THE IMPACT. THE LOCOMOTIVE AND TENDER WERE DAMAGED DOWN THE LEFT SIDE, AS WELL AS SCRAPES DOWN THE SIDE OF THE HEADEND BOX CAR AND FIRST TWO COACHES. THE TRAIN HAD SLTWED TO 15 MPH AT THE TIME OF IMPACT. DAMAGE TO LOCOMOTIVE AND CONSIST TOTALED $9848.NoneNoneNoneNone

9691701-d-09-17-96-AF.Narrative: THE DERAILMENT OCCURRED NEAR & NORTH OF EALUM MILL ST NEAR MP 569.0 IN A CURVE WHICH IS SITUATED BOTH NORTH & SOUTH OF EALUM MILL ST & BEARS TO THE RIGHT. THE CURVE IS 5 DEGREE, 45 MINUTE CURVATURE APPROX. & HAS APPROX. 3" SUPER ELEVATION. AN INVESTIGATION INTO THE DERAILMENT BY COMPANY OFFICIALS DETERMINED THAT WIDE GAUGE WAS THE PRIMARY CAUSE OF THIS DERAILMENT. THE INVESTIGATION DETERMINED THATBOTH CREW MEMBERS OCCUPIED THE CAB OF THE LEAD LOCOMOTIVE, INIT 1751 & THAT THE ENGINEER WAS IN CONTROL OF THE TRAIN. STATEMENTS OBTAINED FROM ENGINEER REFLECT THAT THE THROTTLE POSITION IN LOCOMOTIVE 1751 WAS POSITION 4 & THAT NO BRAKES WERE APPLIED TO EITHER THE LOCOMOTIVES OR CARS. ENGINEER STATED THAT HE HAD RELEASED TRAIN LINE BRAKES NEAR INTERSECTION OF EALUM MILL STREET, A DISTANCE OF APPROX. 600 FEET PRIOR TO THE POSITION OF FINAL REST OF LOCOMOTIVE 1751. ENGINEEC STATED THAT HE 1ST BECAME AWARE OF A PROBLEM WHEN HE FELT THE TRAIN TIGHTEN & SLOW. HE INITIATED A BRAKE APPLICATION USINGTHE AUTOMATIC BRAKE VALVE BUT DID NOT APPLY THE INDEPENDENT LOCOMOTIVE BRAKES. AS HE INITIATED THESEVICE APPLICATION THE TRAIN STOPPED WITHOUT AN EMERGENCY BRAKE DISCHARGE FROM CARNoneNoneNone
